Class Logger

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Logger
public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a facility to log messages on a file. Its construct is private since it implements the Singleton pattern.

Method Summary
static Logger getInstance()
          Return the unique instance of this class.
static Logger getInstance(java.lang.String filename, int verbose, boolean realtime)
          Intialize and return the unique instance of this class.
 void log(java.lang.String s)
          Log a message to the log file and optionally to standard error.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static Logger getInstance(java.lang.String filename,
                                 int verbose,
                                 boolean realtime)
Intialize and return the unique instance of this class. This method should be called only once throughout an entire program execution.
Parameters:
filename - The name of the file to log messages to.
verbose - Verbosity level: the higher the value the more is logged.
realtime - If true logged messages are immediately printed on standard error.
Returns:
The unique instance of the logger object.

getInstance

public static Logger getInstance()
Return the unique instance of this class. This method should be called only after the unique instance of the logger has been created by an invocation of the getInstance method that takes initialization parameters.
Returns:
The unique instance of the logger object.

log

public void log(java.lang.String s)
Log a message to the log file and optionally to standard error. The amount of logging, if any at all, depends on initialization parameters.
Parameters:
s - The message to log to the log file.
